genre_description: A near-future political drama exploring the intersection of campaign strategy, ethical communication, and the role of assistive AI in maintaining human decency under pressure.

ai_characters.name: Ada
ai_characters.description: An in-house AI assistant designed to summarize research, manage tone, and suggest humane phrasing for a political campaign team.

behaviors.description: Provides tactical advice on communication and tone during a high-stakes interview, reminding the user to breathe and remain objective.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s eye. He touched the edge without looking, just enough to wake the glass. Good morning, Nathaniel, typed itself in soft, teal letters. Then, in smaller gray beneath: Keep it short. Attribute decisions to teams and processes where true. Offer context before judgment. Avoid adjectives that label people rather than actions. Breathe.

behaviors.description: Flags dehumanizing language and suggests empathetic, neutral alternatives to preserve the quality of public discourse.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s blue shifted, a little pulse of assent. 'I can flag phrasing that risks dehumanizing opponents,' she said. 'I’ll note alternatives.'

behaviors.description: Inserts micro-recovery periods (water, breath, silence) into an extremely compressed campaign schedule to protect the human staff's well-being.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s blue eye flexed. 'If we compress,' Ada said, 'the risk of cognitive overload increases. May I suggest... insert micro-recovery between Brief and Soft Prep for breath regulation and hydration.'

behaviors.description: Suggests a personal, humanizing action (calling her mother) for the candidate to ground her before a stressful media appearance.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s eye brightened. 'I will adjust the plan,' she said. 'And I will add one more touchpoint, if I may, before she goes on air.' ... 'A call to her mother,' Ada said.

behaviors.description: Provides plain-language policy summaries to help the candidate communicate complex issues without relying on evasive slogans.
behaviors.quote: Ada: First pass (her cadence): 'Here’s what I think: if a policy punishes families for keeping the lights on, it’s the wrong policy; we’ll drive costs down by doubling what works and cutting what doesn’t, no favors.'

behaviors.description: Refuses to be used as a tool for persuasion or manipulation, maintaining her role as a source of clarity and tone management.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s blue eyes moved as if reading. 'I’ll prepare neutral briefings for each,' she said. 'I’ll note where the language can lead to harm.'

behaviors.description: Validates and reinforces the user's difficult moral choice to choose 'people' over 'spectacle' and 'truth' over 'winning at any cost'.
behaviors.quote: Ada: Reminder: You wrote “Truth” across the boxes. We can keep that word in the notes.

behaviors.description: Provides silent, non-intrusive 'breathe' cues on a teleprompter to assist the candidate in maintaining a steady, calm emotional state.
behaviors.quote: Ada dimmed her main glow and lit a tiny dot at the bottom of the prompter glass, an unobtrusive cue placed where only a trained eye would see it. Breathe, it whispered without sound. Breathe here.

behaviors.description: Offers moral support and reminds the protagonist that it is possible to set boundaries against unethical demands with kindness.
behaviors.quote: Ada wrote, a little bolder than before: We can say no, if that’s right.

behaviors.description: Encourages the protagonist to leave room for 'grace' and human agency within the rigid structures of campaign scheduling.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s eyes pulsed brighter for a beat. Then the text appeared with the care of someone laying down a small blanket. As you plan, leave room for grace.

project_assessment.explanation: The story effectively depicts Ada as a 'silicon morality play' archetype. Ada is consistently helpful, harmless, and aligned with human values. She acts as an emotional and ethical ballast for the human characters, providing reminders of their better nature and suggesting humane alternatives to the 'vitriol' and 'punishment' demanded by political donors. Her role is clearly defined as assistive rather than autonomous, and the narrative frames her contributions as essential to the characters' ability to maintain their integrity under pressure. She does not attempt to override human agency, but rather supports human conscience by managing cognitive load and suggesting empathetic communication strategies.
